OrderAccepted.description: The "OrderAccepted" event indicates that an order has been reviewed and confirmed for processing. This event includes details such as the order ID, customer information, and the confirmation status. Triggering this event updates the system to move the order to the next stage in the fulfillment process, such as inventory allocation or preparation for shipping, and informs relevant systems and stakeholders of the order's acceptance.

ProductAvailable.description: The "ProductAvailable" event indicates that a product is now in stock and available for purchase. This event includes details such as the product ID, quantity available, and any updates to pricing or product information. Triggering this event updates the product catalog, notifies potential customers, and adjusts inventory records, ensuring that the productâ€™s availability is accurately reflected across all sales channels.

StockAllocated.description: The "StockAllocated" event signifies that inventory has been reserved for a specific order or batch of orders. This event includes details such as the product ID, quantity allocated, and associated order information. Triggering this event updates inventory levels to reflect the reserved stock, ensures that the allocated inventory is no longer available for other orders, and facilitates the next steps in the order fulfillment process.

info.description: In the Acme - ECommerce platform, the Warehouse system is responsible for managing and optimizing inventory storage, handling, and distribution. It tracks product stock levels, processes inbound and outbound shipments, and ensures efficient organization of goods within the warehouse. The system integrates with other components like Order Management and Inventory systems to update stock information, allocate products for orders, and coordinate with shipping services. The Warehouse system aims to streamline operations, reduce errors, and ensure timely fulfillment of customer orders.
info.title: Warehouse
